comments:
Found in 3.1M7.  Using the following code, each class in it's own source file:

public class Test< T extends Test< T, B, C >, B extends Key< T, B, C >, C
extends State > { }

public class Key< T extends Test< T, K, S >, K extends Key< T, K, S >, S extends
State > { }

public class State { }

Attempting to Open Declaration or Source Hover over the types inside the type
restrictions results in an NPE.  e.g., put the cursor in "State" of the fragment
"S extends State" of Test.java, and hit F3.  The following NPE should occur:

If the Key and Test classes share the same source file, then this error doesn't
occur.

Just an update: content assist, content information, quick fix (but not assist),
and some refactorings (sometimes just display the refactoring menu) also trigger
this.  I have this bug happening in a large project and it pretty much reduces
Eclipse to a basic text editor.

Fixed.

Hover over any of the types/variables.
Verified for 3.1 RC2 using build I20050610-0010
